# Work in progress


Tips on using the plugin
------------------------

Create your Entities with annotations in app\models
extend the Entity class with \li3_doctrine\extensions\data\source\Doctrine [You can avoid this but then you will have to explicitly create the EntityManager object]
By default the plugin uses 'default' connection but you can specify any connection

------------------------------------------------

eg.

//using default connection
$user = new User();
$user->setName('Mr.Right');
$user->getEntityManager()->persist($user);
$user->getEntityManager()->flush();


//using separate connection
$conn = Connections::get('li3');
$doctrine = new \li3_doctrine\extensions\data\source\Doctrine($conn->_config);
$em = $doctrine->getEntityManager();

$user = new User();
$user->setName('Mr.Left');
$em->persist($user);
$em->flush();

------------------------------------------------

The Proxies are created in the cache folder with namespace app\resources\tmp\cache\Doctrine\Proxies
